description:
exp/html: fix foster-parenting when elements are implicitly closed When an element (like or

) was implicitly closed by another start tag, it would keep foster parenting from working because the check for what was on top of the stack of open elements was in the wrong place. Move the check to addChild. Pass 2 additional tests.

messages.text:
Hello nigeltao@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=a718fd96683c *** exp/html: fix foster-parenting when elements are implicitly closed When an element (like or

) was implicitly closed by another start tag, it would keep foster parenting from working because the check for what was on top of the stack of open elements was in the wrong place. Move the check to addChild. Pass 2 additional tests. R=nigeltao CC=golang-dev http://codereview.appspot.com/6460045 Committer: Nigel Tao
